did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Duke University Cooperative Program in the Humanities

did.unittitle: Cooperative Program in the Humanities records
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The records contain general office files, including printed materials, reports, proposals, minutes, correspondence, and other records. Subjects include administration of the Program, the Southeastern Institute of Medieval and Renaissance Studies, and other activities. The materials cover the date range circa 1963-1974.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official university records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Cooperative Program in the Humanities records, circa 1963-1974, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record, November 2014

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Cooperative Program in the Humanities was a joint venture by Duke University and UNC-CH that began in 1963 with the award of a Ford Foundation grant for three academic years. A joint central committee was established to plan and manage the program. The program came to an end in August 1971.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The records contain general office files, including printed materials, reports, proposals, minutes, correspondence, and other records. Subjects include administration of the Program, the Southeastern Institute of Medieval and Renaissance Studies, and other activities. The materials cover the date range circa 1963-1974.

note.label: General note
note.p: In off-site storage; 24 hours advance notice may be required for use.

note.label: General note
note.p: Unprocessed collection. Cataloged from accession records.
